metadata.case_name: Manufacturer of Hacksaw Blades and Bandsaw Blades v. Union of India

facts.text: Appellant is manufacturer of Hacksaw blades and Bandsaw Blades falling under Tariff Item No. 51-A(iv) of the Central Excise Tariff.
Appellant filed classification list as per Rule 173B on 26-3-1985 furnishing tariff rate of 15% ad valorem by mistake instead of effective rates per Notification No. 85/85 CE dated 17-3-1985.
Aggregate value of clearances in preceding year 1984-85 did not exceed Rs. 75 lakhs.
Effective rates: first clearances up to Rs. 7.5 lakhs - nil duty; next clearances of Rs. 7.5 lakhs - 3.75% ad valorem.
Assistant Collector approved 15% ad valorem on 3-6-1985 as appellant did not claim exemption due to ignorance.
Appellant filed revised classification list with effective rates retrospectively from 26-3-1985 on 31-10-1985, which was approved.
Appellant paid excess Rs. 2,55,172.55 as excise duty from 1-4-1985 to 31-8-1985.
Appellant filed refund application under S. 11B on 30-10-1985.
Assistant Collector sanctioned refund partly by order dated 13-12-1985; rejected claim for 1-4-1985 to 27-4-1985 as time-barred, holding relevant date as date of payment by PLA adjustment.
Appellant pleaded that PLA detailing is not starting point; relevant date is RT-12 Returns assessment.
Collector of Central Excise (Appeals) confirmed Assistant Collector's order.
CEGAT dismissed further appeal by order dated 15-4-1988.
Classification list filed 26-3-1985 not approved till 3-6-1985; clearances made by self-determination and PLA debit.
RT-12 Return for April 1985 filed on 8-5-1985, assessed on 29-10-1985.

legal_issues.text: Starting point of limitation for filing refund application under S. 11B of Central Excises and Salt Act, 1944 - whether clause (e) or (f) of Explanation (B) applies.

petitioner_arguments.text: Date of assessment of RT-12 Returns is the date of payment of duty under clause (f).
Alternatively, duty paid provisionally under clause (e) as clearances before approval were provisional akin to R. 9B procedure via self-removal under Chapter VII-A.

respondent_arguments.text: Duty paid by PLA adjustment as goods removed, so relevant date is date of payment under clause (f); claim time-barred.

court_reasoning.text: Rejects initial argument that RT-12 assessment is payment date; PLA debit is effective payment reducing deposit.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Where assessee maintains PLA, debit is effective payment.

court_reasoning.text: Under self-removal procedure (Rules 173B, 173C, 173CC, 173F, 173G, 173I), clearances before classification list approval on 3-6-1985 were provisional akin to R. 9B (no bond needed due to PLA balance).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Clearances between 1-4-1985 and 3-6-1985 provisional; clause (e) applies, relevant date is adjustment after final assessment (RT-12 April assessed 29-10-1985).

court_reasoning.text: Refund claim filed 30-10-1985 within 6 months of 29-10-1985 assessment; not time-barred.

holdings.text: In self-removal procedure, clearances pending classification list approval are provisional payment under S. 11B Explanation (B)(e); limitation starts from date of adjustment after final assessment.

statutes_cited.name: Central Excises and Salt Act, 1944
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs refund claims and appeals; limitation period under S. 11B Explanation (B)(e) and (f) applied to hold provisional payment.

statutes_cited.name: Central Excise Rules, 1944
statutes_cited.relevance: Self-removal procedure; clearances pending approval treated as provisional assessment under R. 9B equivalent.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; appellant held entitled to full refund of Rs. 2,55,172.55; no limitation bar as relevant date under S. 11B (e) is assessment date of 29-10-1985.
outcome.relief_granted: Full refund sanctioned; Tribunal order set aside.

key_quotes.text: "Where an assessee maintains a personal ledger account, duty is paid by way of debit therein and goes to reduce the amount of deposit paid by the assessee. It is not a mere adjustment entry it is effective payment."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects argument that PLA debit is not payment under clause (f).

key_quotes.text: "The amount of duty paid by him was obviously provisional and subject to the result of the final approval by the officer concerned. This is the procedure prescribed under R. 9B..."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Holds clearances pre-approval as provisional, attracting clause (e).

key_quotes.text: "We, therefore, allow the appeal. The appeal has therefore to be allowed holding the appellant is entitled to the full amount and there is no bar of limitation."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Final disposition in favor of appellant.
